name: Characters from Classic Drama Quiz | Literature | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Arthur Miller.

	'Death of A Salesman' - generally considered one of the best American plays. Certainly one of the most famous.

Tennessee Williams.

	'Cat On A Hot Tin Roof' - featuring 'Maggie the Cat'

Edward Albee.

	'Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?' - these are not happy people

Eugene O'Neill.

	'The Iceman Cometh' - interesting character in a long, big-cast play

Oscar Wilde.

	'Importance of Being Earnest' - clever, his best

George Bernard Shaw.

	'Saint Joan' - his most famous (other than 'Pygmalion')

Henrik Ibsen.

	'A Doll's House' - big-time feminism in its day

questions.text: James, Ella, Jamie and Edmund Tyrone
questions.explanation:
Eugene O'Neill.

	The haunted family in the autobiographical 'Long Day's Journey into Night'. What a life!

Samuel Beckett.

	The two tramps in 'Waiting for Godot' - famous, but not exactly easy entertainment

Tennessee Williams.

	'Streetcar Named Desire' - generally considered one of the best American plays. Certainly one of the most famous.
